description: The Ebola outbreak has everyone searching for ways to combat the virus. WHO is investigating the use of convalescent serum. Due to the many challenges regarding this approach, however, I think that doctors should be focusing their efforts on developing alternative treatments. There is no evidence that this type of therapy significantly helps those infected, and there are complications such as the cultural stimuli regarding losing blood and the possible transfer of other diseases such as HIV and hepatitis C. Those trying to curb the Ebola epidemic should put their time and money into finding more feasible solutions, starting with detecting the virus and keeping it contained.
summary: WHO investigates the use of convalescent serum to treat Ebola, but the effectiveness of this therapy is debatable.
title: Ebola Treatments: Should We Use Convalescent Serum?
